intro: Mastichodendron oxyacantha, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a unique plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is used in traditional medicine. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its thick, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Despite its resilience, it requires careful handling due to the irritant properties of its sap.
